info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 30 at 1:50AM CDT until June 30 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
At 150 AM CDT, Doppler radar continued to indicate scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms producing moderate to heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain fell since Sunday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area overnight. Flash flooding is possible.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... El Dorado, Andover, Augusta, Rose Hill, Douglass, Towanda, Benton, Whitewater, Leon, Potwin, Elbing, Burns, Santa Fe Lake, El Dorado Airport, Augusta Municipal Airport, El Dorado Lake and El Dorado State Park.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR BUTLER COUNTY
